====Readings====
* {{ja-readings|on=[[しょう]] (shō)|kun=[[みことのり]] (mikotonori), [[つげる]] (tsugeru)|nanori=}}

====Usage notes====
This is one of only three everyday kanji with a 5 morae reading, and one of only two nouns, namely {{m|ja|詔|tr=みことのり, mikotonori}}. The only other kanji with a 5 morae reading are {{m|ja|承}}, in the verb {{m|ja|承る|tr=（うけたまわ）る, uketamawa-ru}}, and {{m|ja|志||tr=こころざし, kokorozashi}}, and no everyday kanji have a 6 or more morae reading.

The unusually long reading is due to it representing a triple compound word, analyzed as 御言宣 ''mi-koto-nori,'' yielding 1+2+2=5.
